oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1945-04-06 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Prince Albert sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from featuring Louis Buck (announcer), Roy Acuff (host, performer), the Old Hickory Singers (performers), Tommy Magness (performer), Smoky Mountain Boys (performers), Minnie Pearl (performer), Red Foley (performer), Jimmy Riddle (performer), and the Duke of Paducah (performer) from April 6, 1946 on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Duke of Paducah; Jimmy Riddle; Red Foley; Smoky Mountain Boys; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Tommy Magness
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening statement (Louis Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louis Buck talks and introduces Roy Acuff -- Roy Acuff talks and introduces the first tune -- Great Speckled Bird (Roy Acuff) -- Roy acuff talks and introduces the Duke of Paducah -- Comedy routine (Duke of Paducah) -- Twelfth Street Rag (Jimmy Riddle fiddle) -- Roy Acuff talks and introduces Louis Buck -- Louis Buck recites a Prince Albert poem -- Prince Albert commercial (Louis Buck) -- Roy Acuff talks about and introduces Red Foley -- Red Foley talks and introduces the next tune -- Shame On You (Red Foley) -- Roy Acuff talks and introduces the Smoky Mountain Boys -- You Two-Timed Me One Time Too Often (Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Mandy Lee (Old Hickory Singers) -- Roy Acuff introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Were You There When They Crucified My Lord (Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert commercial (Duke of Paducah, Louis Buck) -- Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Roy Acuff talks and introduces Red Foley as the new master of ceremony at the Opry -- Red Foley talks and introduces the next tune -- Old Shep (Red Foley) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Magness fiddle, Roy Acuff call-outs) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff, Louis Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Magness, Tommy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Cannon, Sarah Ophelia, 1912-1996;
